The three kinds of purification by weari: A mendicant is ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, with good behavior and supporters.

A mendicant accomplished in ethics, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, second absorption, third absorption, fourth absorption.
A mendicant accomplished in immersion realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life.

Old deeds are eliminated by experiencing their results little by little.
This wearing away is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.
